replies.msg:
Paired clubs
The country protection rules mean that no two teams from the same country can be drawn together in the same group. Uefa has also tried to ensure that no two teams from the same country play on the same days wherever possible and has hence paired teams from the same country together to avoid the clash.

Here is the list of paired teams.

A Bayern & Dortmund
B Sevilla & Atlético de Madrid
C Real Madrid & Barcelona
D Liverpool & Man. United
E Juventus & Inter
F Paris & Marseille
G Zenit & Lokomotiv
H Man. City & Chelsea
I Shakhtar & Dynamo Kyiv
J RB Leipzig & Mönchengladbach
K Lazio & Atalanta

Uefa have thus divided the eight groups into two section. Groups A-D are classified as red while Groups E-H are classified as blue. No paired teams can be in the same section. For example, if Liverpool are drawn in any of Groups A-D, then Manchester United their paired team can only be drawn in Groups E-H.

A Bayern & Dortmund
B Sevilla & Atlético de Madrid
C Real Madrid & Barcelona
D Liverpool & Man. United
E Juventus & Inter
F Paris & Marseille
G Zenit & Lokomotiv
H Man. City & Chelsea
I Shakhtar & Dynamo Kyiv
J RB Leipzig & Mönchengladbach
K Lazio & Atalanta

Uefa have thus divided the eight groups into two section. Groups A-D are classified as red while Groups E-H are classified as blue. No paired teams can be in the same section. For example, if Liverpool are drawn in any of Groups A-D, then Manchester United their paired team can only be drawn in Groups E-H.

Paired clubs
The country protection rules mean that no two teams from the same country can be drawn together in the same group. Uefa has also tried to ensure that no two teams from the same country play on the same days wherever possible and has hence paired teams from the same country together to avoid the clash.

Here is the list of paired teams.

A Bayern & Dortmund
B Sevilla & Atlético de Madrid
C Real Madrid & Barcelona
D Liverpool & Man. United
E Juventus & Inter
F Paris & Marseille
G Zenit & Lokomotiv
H Man. City & Chelsea
I Shakhtar & Dynamo Kyiv
J RB Leipzig & Mönchengladbach
K Lazio & Atalanta

Uefa have thus divided the eight groups into two section. Groups A-D are classified as red while Groups E-H are classified as blue. No paired teams can be in the same section. For example, if Liverpool are drawn in any of Groups A-D, then Manchester United their paired team can only be drawn in Groups E-H.
